title: How to Make Genoise Cake

steps.headline: Grease and flour two 8-inch (20 cm) cake pans.
Combine eggs, sugar and vanilla in a large mixing bowl.
Place bowl in another bowl of hot water.
Beat 5 minutes using an electric mixer until the mixture is very light.
Remove the bowl from the hot water and let the batter cool.
Cut the flour into the cooled batter using folding motions.
steps.description: Do this three times using a spatula to fold in the flour.

steps.headline: Fold in the melted and cooled butter.
Immediately pour the batter into two 8-inch round cake pans.
Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean.
Cool cakes on wire baking racks.
Fill with favorite buttercream frosting or use to make Petit Fours.

tyn: Electric mixer --- needed for this recipe unless you have a strong arm and plenty of time.
Mixing bowl to hold warm water to make a hot water bath for the cake batter
Cake tester or wooden toothpick to test the cake
text: Preheat oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Grease and flour two 8-inch (20 cm) cake pans.  Combine eggs, sugar and vanilla in a large mixing bowl.  Place bowl in another bowl of hot water.  Beat 5 minutes using an electric mixer until the mixture is very light. It should be fluffy. Remove the bowl from the hot water and let the batter cool.  Cut the flour into the cooled batter using folding motions. Do this three times using a spatula to fold in the flour. Fold in the melted and cooled butter.  Immediately pour the batter into two 8-inch round cake pans.  Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean.  Cool cakes on wire baking racks.  Fill with favorite buttercream frosting or use to make Petit Fours.  Finished.
sentences: Grease and flour two 8-inch (20 cm) cake pans.
Combine eggs, sugar and vanilla in a large mixing bowl.
Place bowl in another bowl of hot water.
Beat 5 minutes using an electric mixer until the mixture is very light.
Remove the bowl from the hot water and let the batter cool.
Cut the flour into the cooled batter using folding motions.
Do this three times using a spatula to fold in the flour.
Fold in the melted and cooled butter.
Immediately pour the batter into two 8-inch round cake pans.
Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean.
Cool cakes on wire baking racks.
Fill with favorite buttercream frosting or use to make Petit Fours.
